explanation: The conditional in the final line was reversed: it used count!=2, so the program printed "Yes" when the number of matching positions was not 2. The intended logic is to print "Yes" when exactly two positions match, i.e. count==2. I fixed that single operator from != to ==.
fixed_code:
S=list(input().split())
T=list(input().split())
count=0
for i in range(3):
  if S[i]==T[i]:
    count+=1
print("Yes") if count==2 else print("No")
